H0.text: Earthquake is a quick change in the Earth's crust that seismometers are used to measure.

H1.text: Erosion is a quick change that happens in the crust of our planet that seismometers are used to measure.

H2.text: Flooding is a quick change that happens in the crust of our planet that a seismometer can measure.

H3.text: Weathering is a seismometer used to measure quick changes that happen in the crust of our planet.

A4.text: Seismometers respond to ground displacement and shaking caused by quakes
